intro: Struthanthus gentlei, commonly known as the gentle struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Struthanthus gentlei is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
